Comments_List: Great understanding of trends in theory; ability to evaluate claims.

This class taught me about the history of the major theoretical movements in mid to late 20th century Archaeology. It provided me considerable insights into the nature of archeology as a discipline and became a catalyst for me to think about what theoretical underpinnings I would like to apply to my future research.

This is an extremely challenging course especially for someone like myself who did not have a prior archaeological background. It might be easier on some students if this was a Spring class, which would allow them to learn more background information in the Fall term. 

It also could have used more individual feedback.
I think this subject raises important questions anyone involved in Archaeological or Anthropological research should consider. Therefore I would recommend it to any student of these subjects.
